business.headline: Income Tax ramps up checks on big transactions with new filing and TDS rulesThe Income Tax Department has ramped up efforts to spot individuals who spend heavily but may be hiding their real income, using data analytics and tighter links with financial institutions.
Currency devaluation is quietly eating into your wealth, expert warnsYour money or assets might look the same in your account, but its real value could be slipping away every year, warns expert.

India's $80 billion coal-power boom is running short of water: ReportThirty-seven of the 44 new projects named in the undated power ministry shortlist of future operations are located in areas that the government classifies as either suffering from water scarcity or stress.

World's largest container ship MSC IRINA docks at Vizhinjam SeaportMSC IRINA's docking at Vizhinjam International Seaport signals growing confidence in the port's readiness to handle Ultra-Large Container Vessels (ULCVs).
Sensex opens 382 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Axis Bank gains over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 335.02 points to 82,524.01, while the NSE Nifty50 added 114.85 points to 25,117.90 as of 9:28 am.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty continue market rally today?As per Gift Nifty futures, the Nifty50 is expected to open above Friday's close of 25,003.05. The futures were trading at 25,182 around 8:35 am, suggesting a stronger start to the new trading session.

Stocks to watch on June 9: HDFC Bank, Infosys, Airtel, Tata Steel, MCX, BELThe policy announcements by the RBI improved market sentiment and pushed indices higher. As trading begins on Monday, investors will be looking at some key companies and developments that may impact share prices.

QuBeats bags Rs 25 crore defence grant to build quantum navigation for Indian NavyThe startup will use the money to build a Quantum Positioning System (QPS) for the Indian Navy. This system will help naval ships and submarines navigate even in places where GPS does not work.

RBI rate cut lights up Dalal Street, but will the rally continue?The RBI reduced the repo rate to 5.5% and also changed its policy stance from 'accommodative' to 'neutral', suggesting that it will now wait and watch before making further moves.

India's poverty rate sees sharp decline, falls to 5.3% in 2022-23India's updated consumption data helped offset the World Bank's revised International Poverty Line, reducing the global increase in extreme poverty by 125 million people.

Elon Musk's Starlink gets licence from telecom ministryElon Musk's Starlink has received a crucial licence from India's telecom ministry, paving the way for its satellite internet services in the country.
Elon Musk's Starlink gets licence to launch in India: ReportStarlink had applied for the licence back in 2022, but the process was delayed due to various concerns, including national security.

entertainment.headline: Smriti Irani, Amar Upadhyay to Mouni Roy, celebs at Ektaa Kapoor's birthday bashProducer Ektaa Kapoor celebrated her 50th birthday with the who's of who of Bollywood and the Indian television industry on June 7. However, it was the reunion of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' starcast, including actor turned politician Smriti Irani and actor Amar Upadhyay, that created excitement among the fans. Karan Johar, Manish Malhotra, Krystle DSouza, Anita Hassanandani, Jeetendra and Tusshar Kapoor also attended the party.

Baahubali films to be clubbed, trimmed for theatrical re-release version: ReportWhat SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' films did for Indian cinema is a pure case study. The makers earlier announced that the film will be re-released in theatres soon, and now, there's a new update on the same.

R Madhavan teams up with Priyanka, Mahesh Babu for Rajamouli's SSMB29: ReportR Madhavan has reportedly joined the team of SS Rajamouli's upcoming film 'SSMB29' starring Priyanka Chopra and Mahesh Babu.
Veteran filmmaker Partho Ghosh dies of heart attack at 75, tributes pour inDirector Partho Ghosh died due to a heart attack. He was 75.

Chris Hemsworth's Thor 5 could be in the works, and why that is a brilliant ideaThere's a lot that needs exploring in the 'Thor' universe, and if the MCU has planned 'Thor 5' in its next saga post-'Avengers: Secret Wars', then it's absolutely going to be a master-stroke.

Is Samantha holidaying with Raj Nidimoru in Abu Dhabi? Internet thinks soActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently shared photos from her Abu Dhabi holiday.  The Internet thinks that she is holidaying with filmmaker Raj Nidimoru, her rumoured boyfriend.

Playing with pets, catching up with friends: Inside Priyanka's quick home tripPriyanka Chopra shared a bunch of pictures from her 'quick trip home' in LA. Starting from her playtime with pets to catching up with friends, everything was adorable.

Housefull 5 box office Day 3: Akshay's film eyes Rs 100 crore after 1st weekendAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' earned Rs 87 crore in three days. The film directed by Tarun Mansukhani is now inching closer to the Rs 100 crore mark.

Virat, Anushka are soulmates incomplete without each other: IPL photographerPhotojournalist Arun Sharma, who covered IPL 2025, described Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli's bond after RCB's victory over Punjab Kings. He shared their sweet moments after RCB's first IPL win.

Thug Life box office Day 4: Rs 36 crore for Kamal Haasan's film, lowest in 5 yearsKamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' minted Rs 36.52 crore nett in its first weekend in theatres. This is Haasan's lowest opening numbers in recent years.

Nayanthara's poetic anniversary post for Vignesh overflows with love, romanceNayanthara and Vignesh Shivan are celebrating three years of togetherness on June 3. The actor's special post for her husband is just dripping love.

Sonakshi Sinha down with fever, husband Zaheer Iqbal lifts her mood. WatchSonakshi Sinha, currently down with fever, was seen cuddling with husband Zaheer Iqbal in a playful video where he tried to cheer her up. Fans loved their light-hearted interaction, calling it adorable and heartwarming.

Bigg Boss OTT 3 winner Sana Makbul hospitalised, friend shares updateSana Makbul, winner of 'Bigg Boss OTT 3', was hospitalised shortly after celebrating Eid with her family. The actor received an emotional support message from her friend, Dr Aashna Kanchwala, praying for her speedy recovery.

Kapil Sharma clicks pics, shares warm moment with Sitaare Zameen Par cast. WatchKapil Sharma shared an inside video from Aamir Khan's musical evening. In the clip, he was seen warmly interacting with the cast of 'Sitaare Zameen Par', including debutant actors with special needs.

Actor Jared Leto accused of sexual misconduct by nine women, including minorsOscar-winning actor Jared Leto has been accused by nine women of sexual misconduct, including inappropriate behaviour with underage girls. The actor and his representatives have denied all allegations, calling them false.

Boman Irani attends French Open as birthday surprise, calls it dream come true. PicsBoman Irani fulfilled his childhood dream by attending the French Open in Paris, a surprise birthday gift from his family. The actor shared his experiences through photos and videos on Instagram.

Badshah defends his Dua Lipa remark after severe backlash: Not my mindset, yoursRapper Badshah stirred controversy with a bold comment about Dua Lipa which drew heavy criticism online. He defended his remark as a form of admiration, claiming the backlash reflected others' thinking, not his.

Salman Khan flew to New York, called my husband during treatment: Sonali BendreSonali Bendre recently opened up about Salman Khan's unwavering support during her cancer battle. In a recent interview, she recalled how the superstar flew to New York multiple times and regularly checked in on her throughout her treatment.

Dipika Kakar celebrates Eid in hospital with Shoaib Ibrahim amid Cancer recoveryTV actor Dipika Kakar celebrated Eid al-Adha with husband Shoaib Ibrahim in the hospital. The latter shared a photo on his Instagram Story featuring the couple holding Eidi envelopes.

general news.headline: Honeymoon murder, wife caught, 'lover' arrested: What we know about Meghalaya caseDismissing the Meghalaya Police's official version of Sonam surrendering, Raja's brother, Vipul, told reporters that she did not surrender but was taken into custody from a roadside eatery in Ghazipur after her brother and the dhaba owner alerted the police.

Intent right, words wrong: Goa Minister after video shows him berating doctorGoa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane apologised after facing backlash for publicly scolding a senior doctor during a hospital visit. The minister pointed out that her mother has cancer and he understands the pain of patients.

Five dead after falling off overcrowded local train in Mumbai, several injuredThe incident occurred between Diva and Kopar railway stations of the Central Railway when 5 people fell on the railway tracks from an overcrowded train.

Alcaraz vs Sinner: A Roland Garros epic promising a golden post-Big Three eraFrench Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's epic Roland Garros final reignited the fire of men's tennis, ushering in a thrilling new chapter beyond the Big Three. Their fierce, five-hour, 29-minute duel was a bold promise of greatness to come.

Indian astronaut completes final launch rehearsal. See pics insideShubhanshu Shukla has termed the preparations for the Axiom-4 mission as an "amazing journey" and that he was extremely fortunate to be part of something that is "much larger than yourself".

Meghalaya honeymoon case: Wife had affair, hired hitmen to kill husband, detainedIndore tourist Raja Raghuvanshi was allegedly killed by men hired by his wife, Sonam, during their honeymoon, Meghalaya Director General of Police Idashisha Nongrang said.

They spit, we hit: Trump warns as Los Angeles immigration protest turns violentUS President Trump warned of strong action after protests in Los Angeles turned tense. Tear gas and pepper balls were used without warning as crowds opposed federal immigration raids.

Meghalaya Police is lying: Father of Indore woman detained for husband's murderSonam Raghuvanshi, 24, was detained in Ghazipur earlier today, nearly 10 days after the body of her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, was recovered from a deep gorge in Meghalaya.

A dating app nearly banned Geminis. Are they really that hard to date?No Names, a new socialising app, once put a filter on Geminis. While it has since been removed, here's decoding whether they're really difficult to date (plus, what they're actually looking for).

Israeli forces intercept Gaza-bound aid boat carrying Greta Thunberg, divert itIsraeli forces intercepted a British-flagged aid boat headed to Gaza, detaining 12 activists — including Greta Thunberg and Rima Hassan — who were attempting to breach the longstanding naval blockade.

Murder on honeymoon: What drove wife to plot Indore man's killing in Meghalaya?A senior police official from Meghalaya told India Today TV that it was a cold-blooded murder, adding that the trip had been planned to kill Raja. The cop also said that, after a preliminary probe, an extramarital affair appears to be the primary motive.

Mutual respect will guide us: Yunus writes to PM Modi amid strained tiesIndia and Bangladesh reaffirm their commitment to work together for their people's welfare, says Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus in a letter to PM Narendra Modi. Despite ongoing political tensions, the leaders expressed hope that shared values will guide stronger ties between the two countries.

5 Grand Slams at 22 years, 1 month, 3 days, like Nadal: Alcaraz calls it destinyCarlos Alcaraz called it destiny as he levelled Rafael Nadal's tally of grand slam wins at the same age with his thrilling comeback against Jannik Sinner in the final of the French Open 2025 on Sunday, June 8.

World now knows truth: Tharoor-led delegation on Op Sindoor wraps up US visitA delegation of Indian MPs led by Congress leader Shashi Tharoor wrapped up their US visit, where they met top officials to brief about Operation Sindoor. This mission was India's response to the Pahalgam terror attack. The US strongly supported India's stand against terrorism during these talks.

Watch: Tear gas, pellets fired at Los Angeles protesters without warningPolice and National Guard in Los Angeles fired tear gas and pepper balls at protesters without warning. People had gathered to oppose immigration raids ordered by Trump. The crowd was pushed back near a federal building, and many were hit as chaos broke out after a brief clash.

Delhi sweats through humid night; heatwave grips Jammu regionThe humidity levels were as high as 70 per cent on Sunday night across the national capital. Although the recorded temperature at 5.30 am was 28.6 degrees Celsius, it felt like 32 degrees due to high humid conditions.

Biden 2.0 here we go: Internet mocks Trump after stumble on Air Force One stepsPresident Trump stumbled while climbing Air Force One steps, sparking jokes online comparing him to Joe Biden. Both Trump and Marco Rubio had trouble boarding the plane. The video went viral, and many social media users questioned Trump's health and fitness for office.

Tensions rise in Manipur, Imphal East sub-divisional collector's office set on fireTensions escalated in Manipur after unidentified miscreants set fire to the Sub-Divisional Collector (SDC) Office in Yairipok Tulihal. Protests continue across the Imphal valley following key arrests by the CBI and NIA in separate criminal cases, including a deadly ambush in Moreh and cross-border arms smuggling.

Virat, Anushka are soulmates incomplete without each other: IPL photographerPhotojournalist Arun Sharma, who covered IPL 2025, described Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli's bond after RCB's victory over Punjab Kings. He shared their sweet moments after RCB's first IPL win.

Trump's travel ban on 12 countries comes into effect: What to knowPresident Trump's new travel ban takes effect today, blocking entry from 12 mostly African and Middle Eastern countries. People without valid visas will face strict entry rules. Trump says it targets public-safety and visa overstay risks.

Couple celebrates son's birthday in Kashmir's first Vande Bharat, video angers InternetA Varanasi couple celebrated their son's sixth birthday by cutting a cake in Kashmir's first Vande Bharat Express.

Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital trustee accuses HDFC Bank CEO of fraud, files caseDenying all allegations against its CEO, Sashidharan Jagdishan, HDFC Bank claimed that a false and malicious prosecution had been initiated against him to thwart the recovery of Rs 65 crore.

Karnataka BJP legislators to give a month's salary for Bengaluru stampede victimsKarnataka BJP legislators will donate one month's salary to families of victims killed in the Bengaluru stadium stampede, announced Opposition leader R Ashoka. He also demanded a special assembly session and a judicial probe into the tragedy.

Covid cases in India cross 6,000 mark, six deaths in 24 hours378 new cases have been registered so far in the country over the last 24 hours. Six deaths have also been reported, with three from Kerala, two from Karnataka and one from Tamil Nadu.

sports.headline: Pollution woes? BCCI shifts November Test out of Delhi in fixtures overhaulThe Indian cricket board announced a revised home season schedule for the Test series against West Indies and South Africa later this year. A Test match in Delhi, which was originally scheduled for November, has been moved to Kolkata.

When Jasprit Bumrah gave Cameron Green confidence with special message before surgeryCameron Green revealed that Jasprit Bumrah reached out to the Australian all-rounder before he underwent back surgery late last year. Green is all set to make a return to the Australia lineup for the World Test Championship final against South Africa.

After French Open win, Carlos Alcaraz left sad as Spain lose Nations League finalCarlos Alcaraz was left distraught after Spain lost their UEFA Nations League final against Portugal on Sunday, June 9. Alcaraz secured a comeback win against Jannik Sinner while Spain were beaten on penalties.

For Portugal, would have broken my leg: Cristiano Ronaldo on Nations League final injuryCristiano Ronaldo revealed that he played through pain in the final of the UEFA Nations League against Spain on Sunday, June 8. Ronaldo scored the equaliser in the game as Portugal won their second Nations League title with a win on penalties.

3 winners in Paris: Federer's heartwarming post after epic French Open finalRoger Federer posted a heartwarming message for Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner after their epic French Open final on Sunday, June 8. Alcaraz staged a stunning comeback to beat Sinner in five sets.

Sinner explains why his father had to skip French Open final vs AlcarazJannik Sinner explained the reason why his father had to miss the epic French Open 2025 final against Carlos Alcaraz on Sunday, June 8. Sinner lost an epic battle against Alcaraz which went on for 5 hours and 29 minutes.

5 Grand Slams at 22 years, 1 month, 3 days, like Nadal: Alcaraz calls it destinyCarlos Alcaraz called it destiny as he levelled Rafael Nadal's tally of grand slam wins at the same age with his thrilling comeback against Jannik Sinner in the final of the French Open 2025 on Sunday, June 8.

Alcaraz vs Sinner: A Roland Garros epic promising a golden post-Big Three eraFrench Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's epic Roland Garros final reignited the fire of men's tennis, ushering in a thrilling new chapter beyond the Big Three. Their fierce, five-hour, 29-minute duel was a bold promise of greatness to come.

Ronaldo in tears as Portugal beat Spain on penalties to clinch Nations LeagueLegendary Cristiano Ronaldo could not hold back his tears as Portugal beat Spain to clinch the Nations League. Portugal, held to a 2-2 draw at extra time, beat Spain in the penalties.

Watch: Alcaraz salutes Sinner in touching speech after French Open epicCarlos Alcaraz staged a remarkable comeback to defeat Jannik Sinner in the longest French Open final ever. After the thrilling match, Alcaraz shared a glowing tribute for Jannik Sinner.

2nd unofficial Test, Day 3: Easwaran gives strong audition for No.3 roleAbhimanyu Easwaran's patient knock of 80 runs helped India A take a strong lead on Day 3 against England Lions. The performance boosts his chances for India's top-four batting slot amid tough competition.

5 Grand Slams at 22 years, 1 month, 3 days, like Nadal: Alcaraz calls it destinyCarlos Alcaraz called it destiny as he levelled Rafael Nadal's tally of grand slam wins at the same age with his thrilling comeback against Jannik Sinner in the final of the French Open 2025 on Sunday, June 8.

Alcaraz vs Sinner: A Roland Garros epic promising a golden post-Big Three eraFrench Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner's epic Roland Garros final reignited the fire of men's tennis, ushering in a thrilling new chapter beyond the Big Three. Their fierce, five-hour, 29-minute duel was a bold promise of greatness to come.

Ronaldo in tears as Portugal beat Spain on penalties to clinch Nations LeagueLegendary Cristiano Ronaldo could not hold back his tears as Portugal beat Spain to clinch the Nations League. Portugal, held to a 2-2 draw at extra time, beat Spain in the penalties.

Watch: Alcaraz salutes Sinner in touching speech after French Open epicCarlos Alcaraz staged a remarkable comeback to defeat Jannik Sinner in the longest French Open final ever. After the thrilling match, Alcaraz shared a glowing tribute for Jannik Sinner.

2nd unofficial Test, Day 3: Easwaran gives strong audition for No.3 roleAbhimanyu Easwaran's patient knock of 80 runs helped India A take a strong lead on Day 3 against England Lions. The performance boosts his chances for India's top-four batting slot amid tough competition.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
